result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kaleb Rivera-Reyes

records.addlTxt: received and filed, DPA Progress Report

Defendant Kaleb Rivera-Reyes in court.  Attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas in court for Kaleb Rivera-Reyes.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin.Deputy court clerk cmt.  
Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
Defendant compliant and has completed letter of apology. Court advises defendant that the No Contact Order remains in effect. Case adjourned for review hearing by Zoom, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kaleb Rivera-Reyes in court with attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Patrick O. Ryan  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Deferred prosecution agreement hearing.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.  **Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed. Deferred prosecution agreement

Defendant Kaleb Rivera-Reyes in court with attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Kaleb Rivera-Reyes in court with attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (4/28/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with D.C.L., L.C. and Palermo's located at 3301 W Canal Street.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Kaleb Rivera-Reyes in court with attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Liesl Monroy.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 038713,
Payable Number: 1001311,
Receipt Number: 22RP016255,
Amount: $20.00
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Kaleb Rivera-Reyes not in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/23/22 @ 1p
